truth_answer_0:
Yes, the `pip install --user` command is used to install a package for a single user. This command installs the package in the user's home directory, specifically in the `~/.local` directory. This allows the package to be installed for the current user only, and it does not affect any other users on the system.

Note that the `~` symbol in the command refers to the home directory of the current user. So, when you run `pip install --user`, it will install the package in the `~/.local` directory, which is a subdirectory of the current user's home directory.
